content:
1. What is the significance of clearance in pharmacokinetic experimental tests?
2. How is clearance calculated in pharmacokinetic studies?
3. What is the difference between renal and hepatic clearance?
4. How do you determine the volume of distribution (Vss) for a drug candidate?
5. Can Vss be used to predict the tissue distribution of a drug?
6. What is the relationship between Vss and clearance in pharmacokinetics?
7. How is the bioavailability (F) of a drug candidate determined experimentally?
8. What factors can affect the bioavailability of a drug?
9. How is the area under the concentration-time curve (AUC) measured in pharmacokinetic studies?
10. Can AUC be used to estimate the total exposure of a drug?
11. How does the elimination half-life (t1/2) of a drug relate to its pharmacokinetics?
12. What are the different methods for determining t1/2 experimentally?
13. How do you determine the maximum concentration (Cmax) of a drug candidate?
14. What is the importance of Cmax in pharmacokinetics?
15. Can Cmax be used to predict the efficacy of a drug?
16. What is the difference between the apparent volume of distribution (Vd) and Vss?
17. How do you calculate the fraction absorbed (Fa) of a drug?
18. Can Fa be used to predict the rate of absorption of a drug?
19. What is the relationship between clearance and the rate of elimination (Ke) of a drug?
20. How do you calculate the mean residence time (MRT) of a drug in the body?
21. Can MRT be used to predict the duration of action of a drug?
22. How do you determine the rate of metabolism (CLmet) of a drug?
23. What factors can affect the rate of metabolism of a drug?
24. What is the role of transporters in the pharmacokinetics of a drug?
25. How can transporter-mediated drug interactions be studied experimentally?
26. How do you determine the fraction of a drug bound to plasma proteins (fu)?
27. Can fu be used to predict the distribution of a drug in the body?
28. What is the difference between the total clearance (CLtot) and the intrinsic clearance (CLint) of a drug?
29. How do you calculate the hepatic extraction ratio (Eh) of a drug?
30. Can Eh be used to predict the extent of hepatic metabolism of a drug?
